subject: Re: [junit] results
msgSnippet: ... Not sure - though I wonder why you would want to...  Check out the api - manually running the tests and storing the results in a TestResult would seem to
messageBody:
At 10:14 AM 23/10/01, you wrote:
>Hai ,
> thank u for helping me out.But I was asking a way by which the results
> can be generated and be stored as a part of the testing code in junit itself.



Not sure - though I wonder why you would want to... Check out the api -
"manually" running the tests and storing the results in a TestResult would
seem to give you the option of doing what you want.





--

* Jim Cheesman *
Trabajo:
jchees@... - (34)(91) 724 9200 x 2360
I disagree
with unanimity.
